articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Minor b6th in E (Shape: G)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Minor b6th in E (Shape: G)

## Brief Presentation:
This arpeggio is a Minor arpeggio with a flattened 6th note, commonly played in the key of E using shape G. It adds a unique flavor to your playing and can convey a melancholic or mysterious tone due to the addition of the b6th note.

## Notes and Intervals:
The notes in this arpeggio are:
- E (Root)
- G (Minor 3rd)
- B (Perfect 5th)
- C (Flattened 6th)

The intervals between these notes create the Minor b6th arpeggio sound.

## Genre and Musical Flavor:
Arpeggios like the Minor b6th in E (Shape: G) are often found in various genres such as Jazz, Blues, and Rock. This particular arpeggio adds a touch of tension and color to your playing. It can be used to create moody or dissonant sounds, adding depth and emotion to your musical compositions.

## Songs:
Here are three songs that feature the Minor b6th arpeggio in E (Shape: G):
1. "Black Magic Woman" by Santana
2. "Hotel California" by Eagles
3. "Gravity" by John Mayer

These songs showcase how the Minor b6th arpeggio can be used to create a captivating and expressive musical experience.
